title: There Was an Old Lady Who Swallowed Fly Guy
author: Tedd Arnold

book_level.description: Early reader level - humorous adaptation of classic nursery rhyme

questions.question: What is the name of the boy in the story?
questions.explanation: The boy's name is Buzz, and he has a pet fly.

questions.question: What is the fly's name?
questions.explanation: The fly is named Fly Guy.

questions.question: Who did Buzz go to visit with Fly Guy?
questions.explanation: Buzz went to visit his grandma, and Fly Guy went too.

questions.question: How did Grandma feel when she saw Buzz arrive?

options.A: She felt very angry at him
options.D: She felt happy to see him

questions.explanation: Grandma was happy to see Buzz and ran to hug him.

questions.question: What happened to Fly Guy when Grandma hugged Buzz tightly?

options.B: He flew far away from them

questions.explanation: When Grandma hugged Buzz, she accidentally swallowed Fly Guy.

questions.question: When Fly Guy went down into Grandma's stomach, he found himself in...

options.A: a bright sunny place with flowers growing everywhere around him
options.B: a deep dark hole with a wet place at the very bottom
options.C: a small cozy room with soft walls all around him
options.D: a colorful garden with many pretty butterflies flying

questions.explanation: Fly Guy went down a deep dark hole and came to a wet place at the bottom.

questions.question: After swallowing Fly Guy by accident, Grandma swallowed a spider because...

options.A: she was feeling very hungry and wanted something to eat
options.B: she really liked spiders and thought they tasted good
options.C: she wanted to catch Fly Guy and bring him back out
options.D: it was a complete accident just like swallowing Fly Guy

questions.explanation: Grandma swallowed a spider to catch Fly Guy.

questions.question: The order of animals Grandma swallowed kept getting bigger and bigger, going from spider to bird to cat to dog to...

options.A: a cow and then a horse
options.B: a goat and then a cow
options.C: a pig and then a cow

questions.explanation: After the dog, Grandma swallowed a goat, then a cow.

questions.question: Grandma was just about to swallow a horse when suddenly...

options.A: she fell asleep and started to snore very loudly
options.B: the horse ran away as fast as it could go
options.C: Buzz finally stopped her from doing it anymore
options.D: Fly Guy came out of her mouth at last

questions.explanation: Before Grandma could swallow the horse, Fly Guy came out.

questions.question: When all the animals came out of Grandma, they were all...

options.A: safe and okay just like Fly Guy was
options.B: very angry at Grandma for eating them
options.C: too tired to move or do anything
options.D: scared and ran far away from her

questions.explanation: All the animals came out safely along with Fly Guy.

questions.question: Why is this story funny to readers?

options.A: Because Buzz has a very strange and unusual name
options.B: Because the idea of swallowing bigger animals to catch smaller ones is silly and impossible
options.C: Because Grandma is a very old and forgetful lady
options.D: Because flies are always funny insects in stories

questions.explanation: The humor comes from the absurd chain of swallowing bigger and bigger animals, which is impossible in real life.

questions.question: What does this story teach about solving problems?

options.A: You should always ask someone else for help first
options.B: Animals are very good at solving hard problems
options.C: Sometimes simple solutions work better than complicated ones that make things worse
options.D: Grandmas always know the best way to fix things

questions.explanation: Each animal Grandma swallows creates a bigger problem, showing that making solutions more complicated doesn't always help.

questions.question: This story is based on a famous nursery rhyme. What makes this version special?

options.A: It uses dinosaurs instead of regular farm animals
options.B: It is set in outer space with aliens and rockets
options.C: It has no animals in the story at all anywhere
options.D: It features Fly Guy as the main character and has a happy ending

questions.explanation: This version puts Fly Guy in the old nursery rhyme and gives it a happy ending where everyone comes out safely.

questions.question: Why might the author have chosen a fly as Buzz's pet?

options.A: Because flies are very cute and fluffy animals
options.B: Because having a fly as a pet is unusual and surprising, which adds to the humor
options.C: Because flies are easy to take care of at home
options.D: Because flies are very colorful and pretty insects

questions.explanation: A fly is an unusual pet choice, which makes the story funny and surprising from the very beginning.

questions.question: What is the meaning of the ending 'they lived happily ever after'?

options.A: Grandma decided to get a pet fly too
options.B: Buzz moved in with Grandma forever
options.C: The horse became everyone's new pet
options.D: Everyone including Fly Guy and all the animals survived and were okay

questions.explanation: The happy ending shows that Fly Guy and all the animals that came out of Grandma were fine, ending the silly adventure on a positive note.
